Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <jabe> My reading of it is that they tried to expand in early 2018 at the top of the bull market, borrowed lots of money but then business declined in the bear market and they were unable to keep pace. 
Problems go back way before the alleged hack in January. 
It was probably obvious a long time ago (to anyone with access to the information) that they were heading towards going bust.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> was there any reason why they did not allow duplicate receivers int he first place?
As it looks the protocol is not affected it's just removed from the rpccall right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX never was a consensus rule in any coin that I know

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX i think it's intended to prevent abuse but it actually only makes valid use more annoying

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX ZEC is not focused on communications, Hush is

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> ( I accutaly was annoyed by that issue as I could not figure out why only one payment was send to the address )

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is a core thing. ZEC is much like BTC, where financial transactions are focused on, not other applications

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX i made this change in the old  Hush codebase long ago, to enable HushList stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> cool! I thought maybe it had something to do with the protocol but good to know it was just the rpccall

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's purely in RPC land

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> send a PR to ZEC and I'm sure there will be 227 comments about it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> oh, there is a big history already üòÖ , and that PR already exists, and somebody else wrote it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> ow I see üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I believe VOT coin suggested this to ZEC, and I saw it get denied

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and VOT didn't want to diverge from ZEC so they threw it away, but I saw it was very valuable for HushList protocol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it allows you to easily send a 27KB file in a single transaction, to your friend, versus only being able to send 512 bytes in a single transaction (without resorting to raw transactions, which have very very little support with zaddrs currently)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and then to send larger files, you can string along these units of 27KB (which have units of 512bytes inside)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> until you get to your block size

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> 27KB sounds like a good amount of data for most things you don't want anybody else to read

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 512 bytes is pretty limiting when you think about unicode and emoji and including URLs, etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> many emails are probably less than 27KB in textual content, but 512 bytes would be limiting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> yes true

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> z_listunspent didnt used to display the position

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so if more than one to same address, it was ambiguous

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> but we added position info

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if we can store a PDF, it's possible to store a signed/notarized/legal copy of a will, inside an encrypted memo field, on the blockchain, which can be verified by any full node in the world

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c thanks for that clarity, didn't know that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> not sure how to specify vout position for ztx though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c `outindex`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is what z_listunspent gives for sapling zutxos now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and that is what z_createrawtransaction will intake

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> as long as z_sendmany iterates through the outindex and can spend duplicate funds, it seems fine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> {txid: "txid", "outindex": 0 }

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> >>signed/notarized/legal l copy of a will
That's pretty useful! I'm sure somebody will do an ico about that / or already did

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c i used to do this on the old Hush v2 codebase, i never ran into issues, but that was sprout and everything has changed. I will do some testing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I do think i was the one who reported the lack of a unique index for sprout stuff, to zec, and that made them add some keys to rpc output

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/2955

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX there is your blast from the past

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> open issue from Feb 16, 2018

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ZEC likes to age their issues nice and old, like a fine whisky

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> the real test is to just make an address get a few duplicate zutxo and try to spend all the funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX you want to fund my shielded will startup? üëº I have seen a few other things vaguely like this idea, but nothing that has real tech behind it. With sprout it was a fantasy, with Sapling it's very possible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> Sure I chip a couple hush or kmd inüëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX most of the tech already exists, the real value-add is partnering with estate planners and financial advisors, to provide it like a SaaS

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the first step is the simplest way to store files in the blockchain, i have that all mapped out pretty well. it can be done from a wallet or even a website

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX how much would you pay to store a small encrypted file in the ARRR blockchain ? What is that service worth? If people value this service, there are a lot of potential. I mentioned wills before because they are extremely important documents, but it works for any data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you can choose to keep the file private, just sending it to yourself, or a website could allow you to upload a file and then provide a web-proxy URL to view it. Any full node would be able to access it as well, the web-proxy is mostly convenience and to show off that the file is actually there and accesible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> To me it would be worth to store a document for $100 on a worldwide ledger if I can only access it with a privkey.
There are certain documents I can imagine that I don't want to have at my house or even in a vault under my name.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <CHMEX> having it stored in a fully private chain also makes it QR no?
as there is no address data leaking it would not be possible to find out the receiving address.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @CHMEX you are asking about quantum-resistant? I am not sure
